title: Call for speakers on fleet safety
summary:
The FleetOwner team is in search of fleet safety experts interested in speaking at this year's Safety Leadership Conference in Scottsdale, Nov.10-12.
The annual Safety Leadership Conference, an education and networking opportunity for leaders in occupational safety and health, compliance and risk management, is launching a new track this year on Fleet Safety and is soliciting proposals from fleet safety experts.
The most important element of the Safety Leadership Conference is the educational component contributed by the experts speaking in five tracks: safety and risk management, compliance, construction and safety technology, and new this year, fleet safety.
The Fleet Safety track focuses on programs and best practices that keep drivers, technicians, other employees and the general public safe.
If you are an fleet safety professional and would like to share your professional experiences and program successes at this event, we encourage you to respond to this Call for Speakers.

title: Scottsdale Gallery Association Announces “Demonstrate… and Donuts
summary:
On Thursday, January 16, 2020 from 6:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m., the Scottsdale Gallery Association honors first responders through their first Gold Palette ArtWalk of the New Year and in continued celebration of the organization’s 45th season.
Themed “Demonstrate… and Donuts,” this special Gold Palette ArtWalk will feature donut-sampling opportunities at many of the Scottsdale Arts Districts’ participating galleries along Main Street from Scottsdale Road to Goldwater Boulevard and north of Indian School on Marshall Way to 5th Avenue.
Local donut shops are donating the sweet treats, and entertainment includes traditional bagpipe musical performances and demonstrations from local artists.
“We are indebted to the protection and safety that our Scottsdale Police and Fire Departments provide to residents and businesses throughout the city,” according to Scottsdale Gallery Association President French Thompson.
During the Scottsdale Gallery Association’s weekly Gold Palette ArtWalk, presented in partnership with the City of Scottsdale, the Scottsdale Arts District offers free trolley and horse-drawn carriage rides to various restaurants, museums, galleries and more throughout Old Town Scottsdale.

title: Italian steakhouse concept, The Americano, to open in Scottsdale
summary:
SCOTTSDALE, AZ — An Italian steakhouse is headed to Scottsdale in 2020.
Pomo Restaurant Group, the group behind a handful of restaurants in the Valley, including Pomo Pizzeria, Mora Italian, and Meat The Ball, recently announced their plans to open The Americano, a contemporary Italian steakhouse, in north Scottsdale.
The Americano is expected to open in early 2020.
The restaurant's menu will feature fine steaks, certified Italian Piedmontese cattle, domestic Wagyu beef, house-made pasta, salads, antipasti, a raw bar, and caviar, according to the announcement.
It will have an open kitchen, a wood-fired grill, a bar and lounge, and an outdoor patio.

title: Arizona Boom Draws Californians and Changes Political Hue
summary:
On the surface, adding new people and new subdivisions is the same thing the Arizona economy was doing as the real estate bubble inflated.
But the nature of Arizona’s growth — and the kinds of workers it has attracted — has changed.
The recent expansion, on the other hand, is marked by the growth of finance and technology companies that employ people like Mr. Jordan.
Technology companies have expanded their head count by about 30 percent in that time, while construction employment is still 24 percent lower than its peak before the recession.
If construction and subprime loans were symbolic of the state’s last boom, this time the image would be offices like WebPT, which makes software used by physical therapists and rehabilitation specialists to manage billing and medical information.

"President Trump has transformed the economy of Arizona, creating more than 238,600 jobs in the state since he was elected," Michael Glassner, chief operating officer of Donald J. Trump for President Inc., said in a written statement.
"President Trump has delivered on his promises and he looks forward to celebrating those successes with the great men and women of Arizona."
Trump will use his return to Arizona, which he carried in 2016 by 3.5 percentage points, to energize Republicans and nonvoters who may support Trump but have not necessarily voted in recent elections.

title: Chilly morning as Arizona sees temperatures at or below freezing in some areas
summary:
(Photo: Sean Logan/The Republic)Several areas of Arizona saw temperatures fall at or below freezing early Tuesday, as a freeze warning remained in effect for portions of the lower Arizona deserts through Wednesday, according to the National Weather Service.
While Phoenix stayed a bit warmer at 38 degrees around 6 a.m., Scottsdale saw 33 degrees and Glendale posted its mark at 32 degrees, the weather service reported.
A Freeze Warning remains in effect for portions of the lower Arizona deserts today and Wednesday morning.
"The lower deserts will be quite cold today and Wednesday, with the coldest temperatures likely on Wednesday," the weather service tweeted on Tuesday morning.
High temperatures on Tuesday across northern Arizona are forecast as 26 degrees in Flagstaff, 39 degrees in Payson, 30 degrees in Heber and 31 degrees in Window Rock, according to the weather service.

title: Waste Management Phoenix Open survives all challenges by embracing its rowdy identity
summary:
CLOSEThe Waste Management Phoenix Open has survived threat after threat to become one of the world’s biggest sporting events, and there’s no reason to think that’s going to change.
But “The People’s Open” has endured all challenges by embracing its identity as golf tournament mixed with a music festival.
There have only been three instances since 2004 that weekly Phoenix Open attendance didn’t go over half a million.
But regardless of which top draws showed up or how they played, the atmosphere felt about like it always feels at the Phoenix Open.
The Phoenix Open embraces its identity as a cross between a rock concert and a sporting event, and its crowds are the reward.

Making important advancesBioLab’s latest regenerative product MyOwn Skin is turning heads for its success in the skin graph segment.
The technology uses a 1-cm square sample of the patient’s skin to grow a larger size to accommodate what is needed to cover and treat the area.
Company data indicates that in 80 percent of the cases where MyOwn Skin is applied, one application is all it takes for unprecedented healing to occur.

title: Frank Lloyd Wright architecture school at Taliesin reverses decision, looks to remain open
summary:
CLOSETaliesin West was architect Frank Lloyd Wright's winter home and school in the desert from 1937 until his death in 1959 at the age of 91.
Today it is the main campus of the School of Architecture at Taliesin and houses the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation.
It remains unclear whether the foundation that oversees Frank Lloyd Wright's Taliesin properties in Scottsdale and Wisconsin will agree.
Aaron Betsky, president of the School of Architecture, said the decision to try to remain open comes as the school secured other funding sources.
The earlier decision to close came as the school board and the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation, which oversees Frank Lloyd Wright's Taliesin properties in Scottsdale and Wisconsin, couldn't reach an agreement on the school's future.

title: Scottsdale hotel clerk shoots at, helps catch burglary suspect

SCOTTSDALE, AZ — A Scottsdale motel clerk stopped an alleged burglary in progress as he was making his rounds last week.
Scottsdale police report that around 4 a.m. on October 21, they responded to a shooting call at the Extended-Stay America hotel near Scottsdale Road and Shea Boulevard.
Police say Bays responded by saying, "Hey, you shot me," before running to a nearby apartment complex.
Police say the clerk was able to give them a detailed description of Bays, including his "heavily tattooed legs."

title: Construction begins on 160-unit Gramercy Scottsdale
summary:
High Street Residential, the residential subsidiary of Trammell Crow Company, and its partner, Principal Real Estate Investors, announced that construction has begun on a luxury 160-unit multifamily development in the heart of Downtown Scottsdale.
The five-story Class A building, known as Gramercy Scottsdale, sits on two acres of land just north of the Scottsdale Road and Camelback Road intersection.
Gramercy Scottsdale will offer a mix of studios, one-, and two-bedroom units, in addition to three-bedroom penthouses.
“Downtown Scottsdale continues to be a top valley destination, with new shopping, restaurant and entertainment options opening regularly.
Gramercy Scottsdale capitalizes on the area’s walkability and its push to become a true live/work/play destination for residents,” said Paul Tuchin, Principal of High Street Residential’s Phoenix office.

title: Construction underway for 2020 Waste Management Phoenix Open
summary:
SCOTTSDALE, AZ — Even though the tournament is still three months away, hundreds of construction workers are busy building viewing boxes and other infrastructure for the 2020 Waste Management Phoenix Open.
"We call it building a city and that's really what we're doing," tournament chairman Tim Woods told ABC15.
Historically, Woods said construction starts during the first few weeks of October but with several changes and additions for the upcoming tournament, work this year began on September 16th.
"The planning cycle really never stops," he said, adding the first meeting for the 2020 tournament was the day after the final putt of the 2019 tournament.
The 2020 Waste Management Phoenix Open begins Monday, January 27th, 2020.

The new type of retail startup allows small companies to share space — and foot traffic — in brick-and-mortar stores.
The Merchantile of Scottsdale will officially open for business this Friday, with a Grand Opening celebration planned all weekend long.
“The vision behind The Merchantile’s co-retail concept is to help small local businesses grow by offering a trendsetting destination retail space with an ever-changing mix of hip products cultivated by Arizona tastemakers and artisans,” said Founder Kimberly Pak.
Founders Kimberly and Eugene Pak spearheaded the co-retail initiative to address the need for a collaborative small business incubator specifically for retailers and creatives in Scottsdale.

title: Police involved in early morning pursuit on Salt River Reservation
summary:

The vehicle could be seen driving on unpaved roads and through farmland, according to live news footage.
The driver of the vehicle did not yield to the police and drove down paved and dirt roads.

Officers apprehended the driver and two other passengers after the vehicle was stopped.

title: Monsoon 2019 closes as the driest on record for a handful of Arizona cities
summary:
PHOENIX – This year’s monsoon season was one of Arizona’s driest ever.
Bellemont, Grand Canyon Village, Phantom Ranch, Show Low, Teec Nos Pos and other locations also experienced their driest monsoon on record.
For Phoenix, this year’s monsoon season, which ended Monday, was the fifth driest since record-keeping began in 1896.
The National Weather Service calls last week’s mess a “transition event” – a bridge between the monsoon and the fall weather pattern.
The state averages four tornadoes per year, according to the National Weather Service; since 1950, there have been 247 confirmed twisters in Arizona.

205, the Smart and Safe Arizona Act would cap the number of retail stores carrying marijuana at about 150 statewide — at least initially.

title: Arabian Horse Show brings $98M economic impact to Scottsdale
summary:
The Arabian Horse Association of Arizona (AHAA) is returning for the 65th annual Scottsdale Arabian Horse Show at WestWorld of Scottsdale.
The world’s largest, family-friendly horse show runs Thursday, Feb. 13 through Sunday, Feb. 23 and is expected to attract hundreds of thousands of spectators.
“More than 2,400 Arabian horses from all over the globe will participate in this year’s event,” said Taryl O’Shea, executive director of the AHAA.
Families will have several free activities to choose from including ice cream socials, ceramic horse painting, art contests, behind-the-scenes barn tours, educational round pen demonstrations, and the opportunity to meet an Arabian horse.
“Families who come out for this one-of-a-kind experience won’t be disappointed.”The 2020 Scottsdale Arabian Horse Show is proud to benefit several local charities including Healing Hearts Animal Rescue and Refuge, Horses Help TRC, Scottsdale Community College, Youth For Troops and March of Dimes.

title: Waste Management Phoenix Open named PGA Tournament of the Year
summary:
The Waste Management Phoenix Open (Scottsdale, Arizona) was honored by the PGA TOUR at the TOUR’s Tournament Meetings on November 20.
For the second consecutive season, the Waste Management Phoenix Open was named the PGA TOUR “Tournament of the Year,” marking the fourth time (2014, 2015, 2018 and 2019) in the last six years the event has taken top honors.
“On behalf of the PGA TOUR, I am thrilled to congratulate the Waste Management Phoenix Open on once again being named the ‘Tournament of the Year,’” said PGA TOUR Chief Tournaments and Competitions Officer Andy Pazder.
Proceeds from the 2019 Waste Management Phoenix Open generated a record $13.2 million for local charities, the highest single-year charitable donation in tournament history.
“Since Waste Management became title sponsor in 2010, we are proud of the positive impact the Waste Management Phoenix Open continues to bring to benefit the community and the environment,” said Jim Fish, President and CEO of Waste Management.

title: Scottsdale Airpark evolves into urban ’18-hour’ city
summary:
Colliers International in Arizona has released its Greater Scottsdale Airpark 2030 Report, which highlights market conditions and predictions for the popular Scottsdale Airpark submarket.
“The Scottsdale Airpark has experienced a renaissance of sorts, formulating its own urban character that is proving very attractive to employers,” says Jim Keeley, SIOR, CCIM, founding partner of the Scottsdale Office of Colliers International in Arizona.
“Land prices have escalated so much in the Airpark that developers can’t rationalize building that product type here anymore.”Retailers have been taking occupancy of spaces in Scottsdale Airpark.
Rental rates in Scottsdale Airpark have not yet risen to the level of 2008, but building sale prices have exceeded those achieved during that time.
During 2019, 41 different projects in the Scottsdale Airpark were sold.

title: Say it isn't so: Another storm predicted to bring rain on Thanksgiving Day
summary:
A storm this week is predicted to bring rain to the Valley, and snow to the mountains, on Thanksgiving Day.
Rain is expected to begin late Wednesday night or early Thursday morning and continue through Friday, though it may not rain the entire time, said Jaret Rogers, a National Weather Service meteorologist.
Rogers said to expect lows in the mid to upper 40s each day with Saturday temperatures predicted to drop to the low 40s.
A significant winter storm with major travel impacts is looking more likely for Thanksgiving into Friday.
The National Weather Services advises people to keep up to date on the latest forecast and be flexible with their travel plans.

title: Phoenix's biggest weather events of 2019 didn't involve heat. Here's what they were

That wouldn’t even crack the top five on the city’s all-time high temperature list.
The city also saw six high temperature records either beaten or tied during the spring and summer, in addition to five records for warmest overnight low temperatures.

The Satanic Temple, months later, sent a letter to the council warning them against further discrimination.

The Creative Center of Scottsdale, a co-working space in the heart of Old Town dedicated solely to artists, is currently accepting applications from local artists to set up shop during its second annual pop-up fair next spring.
Attendees can peruse local art pieces, take a peek inside the Creative Center of Scottsdale and meet the community of artists who worked there.
The Creative Center of Scottsdale is searching for additional artists who want to participate and sell their work.
Various mediums including painting, sculpture, photography, jewelry/metalsmithing and others will be considered.
“The center is a creative, collaborative space and this event encapsulates that,” said Michelle Biely, owner of the Creative Center of Scottsdale.

title: 8 Phoenix Hanukkah 2019 Events To Bring In The Holiday Spirit
summary:
PHOENIX, AZ ­— Hanukkah (or "Chanukah") is a Jewish light festival Dec. 22-30 featuring special prayers, a nightly menorah lighting, and fried foods.
It commemorates the reclamation of the Jerusalem Holy Temple from the Greeks by a small group of Jews, and it celebrates the temple's rededication thereafter, according to Chabad.org.
With JewishVirtualLibrary.org ranking Phoenix, Mesa and Scottsdale combined as the 11th highest Jewish population in the U.S. as of 2018, it's no wonder Phoenix has quite a few Hanukkah activities this holiday season.
These 8 can help usher in the holiday spirit:

title: Stockdale Capital buys former Henkel HQ in Scottsdale
summary:
Stockdale Capital Partners (“Stockdale”), a Los Angeles-based real estate investment manager, acquired a 371,937 square foot, Class A medical laboratory and creative office building formerly known as Henkel Corporate Center located in the Scottsdale Airpark submarket.
The property, located at 7201 East Henkel Way in Scottsdale, provides high visibility and access to the Loop 101 Freeway, allowing easy access to all major labor markets in the Phoenix metropolitan area.
Additionally, the proposed 120-acre One Scottsdale mixed-use development will further improve the desirability of the area as a premier live/work hub.
Additionally, located only three miles southwest of the property is the 210-acre Mayo Clinic medical campus , home to the Mayo Clinic Hospital, a 209-bed, state-of-the-art, inpatient medical care facility that opened in 1998.
Plans are in the works to develop a 225-acre biomedical corridor, which will be anchored by the Mayo Clinic Hospital and the Mayo Clinic Proton Beam Radiation Therapy Center.

title: Papago Plaza redevelopment: Plans call for more restaurants, grocery store, apartments, and hotel
summary:
SCOTTSDALE, AZ — Construction on the redevelopment of Papago Plaza, the Pueblo-style shopping center near Scottsdale and McDowell road in Scottsdale, is officially underway.
On Thursday, Dec. 5, 2019, developers, Phoenix city council members, and other officials held a ceremonial groundbreaking ceremony at the 11-acre shopping center in south Scottsdale.
Redevelopment plans have reportedly been in the works for the last few years, but until now, development has moved rather slowly.
According to the latest update, the 11-acre shopping center will be turned into an "urban mixed-use lifestyle community...in an orchard-like setting" with restaurants, a grocery store, luxury apartments, and a hotel, a news release said.
Specific tenants who would be part of the shopping center have not been announced.

title: Education, Civil Rights Groups Protest ALEC Summit in Scottsdale
summary:
Protesters gathered outside the Westin in Scottsdale on December 4, 2019 to protest Arizona legislators' attendance at a summit of the American Legislative Exchange Council.
About 150 people from a broad range of Arizona civil rights and education groups gathered outside the Westin Kierland Resort and Spa in Scottsdale on December 4 to protest a summit of the American Legislative Exchange Council being held at the hotel.
Some chants and posters seemed to target corporate influence in politics broadly, more so than they focused on the ALEC summit that was taking place a few hundred feet away.
Nor did it respond to a request for media access to the Scottsdale summit.
On Wednesday, several groups filed a lawsuit in Maricopa County Superior Court against the Arizona Legislature, claiming that its members' attendance at the ALEC Summit would violate state transparency laws.

title: DPS: Trooper shoots, kills man after being attacked near Scottsdale Road off Loop 202
summary:
TEMPE, AZ — A trooper-involved shooting occurred early Friday morning near Loop 202 and Scottsdale Road, officials with Arizona Department of Public Safety say.
DPS trooper Hugh Grant was reportedly working a holiday DUI task force with a citizen observer in the area at the time.
According to DPS during an afternoon press conference, officials said the incident started when trooper Grant spotted a man acting irrationally.
The suspect reportedly kicked trooper Grant's vehicle, which led to the trooper stopping his vehicle and confronting the suspect.
Trooper Grant is still in quite a bit of pain and is recovering at home, according to DPS.

title: No burning allowed on New Year's Eve or New Year's Day in Maricopa County
summary:
(Photo: Anchiy, Getty Images/iStockphoto)Those looking to ring in the new year next to a cozy fireplace will have to find an alternative, as authorities declared New Year's Eve and New Year's Day no-burn days in Maricopa County.
Officials issued a High Pollution Advisory for Dec. 31 and Jan. 1, according to the Maricopa County Air Quality Department.
The department said there should be no wood burning, leaf-blowing or off-roading vehicles on those days, adding that air quality in the county would be unhealthy for sensitive groups.
MORE: Maricopa County has gotten hundreds of complaints on no-burn daysThose wanting to report a violation of the order can reach the department's hotline at 602-372-2703 or fill out an online form.
But even when no-burn days are in effect, consequences are rare.

title: Here is when Nobu restaurant opens in Scottsdale and how to make a reservation
summary:
SCOTTSDALE, AZ — Nobu, a highly anticipated restaurant new to Scottsdale, has announced it will be opening at the end of this month.
The high-end international Japanese restaurant confirmed it will be open for business starting Monday, Jan. 27, 2020.
You can make dinner reservations at Nobu Scottsdale starting Thursday at 10 a.m. Reservations can be made by going online or calling 480-581-0055.
Nobu is one of a handful of new restaurants that have recently come to the area of Scottsdale Fashion Square’s luxury wing.
The Farmhouse, another California-based restaurant, is also expected to open sometime this year in the same area.

title: Camelback Christmas tree is back. Here's why it's controversial, and when you can see it
summary:
An intrepid group of volunteers, including John “Camelback Santa” Cressey, have placed a Christmas tree atop Camelback Mountain in Phoenix.
This year the tree will be placed atop the mountain each morning leading up to Christmas.
On weekends, Camelback Santa will hand out candy canes or coal (depending on which list you’re on) and pose for photos with anyone who’s interested.
“For me, it’s become a tradition for people to come up and see Camelback Santa and get their picture taken with him,” Cressey said.
“The birds and ground squirrels on Camelback love the tree and feast on it,” Cressey said.

Salpointe Catholic back looks to carry production into the postseason.
But as expected, it went right down to the wire.
Chandler finished 13-0 and extended its overall win streak to 26.
Saguaro (11-2), however, it didn't go down without a fight.
The long awaited battle between the Arizona classes went to top-ranked Chandler (Ariz.) Shaffer added a 1-yard touchdown run in the final seconds for Saguaro, but Chandler held on for the hard-fought victory.

title: Scottsdale-Based SuperShuttle Shutting Down
summary:
Tim Agne/KJZZ Signs announce the service's imminent closure as travelers await their SuperShuttle rides at Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix on Sunday, Dec. 29, 2019.
The company, which is headquartered in Scottsdale, is shutting down operations at the end of the year.
3TV/CBS 5 reported Wednesday that SuperShuttle was ending service to Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport.
Founded in 1983 to serve Los Angeles International Airport, SuperShuttle has lost ground to competitors such as Uber and Lyft.
SuperShuttle is owned by an affiliate of Blackstreet Capital Holdings, a private investment firm based in Bethesda, Maryland, court documents show.

title: Oregano's Pizza Bistro bringing another restaurant to Scottsdale in the fall
summary:
SCOTTSDALE, AZ — Update (Dec. 11, 2019): Oregano's expects to open its restaurant near the Loop 101 and Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd., its fourth location in Scottsdale, in January, according to a restaurant spokesperson.
Original story:Fans of Oregano's Pizza Bistro's pizzas, pastas, and pizza cookies, will soon have another place to indulge.
A couple of weeks ago, the Scottsdale-based restaurant chain announced in a Facebook post its plans to open a restaurant in North Scottsdale.
Zen Culinary closed in December 2017, after nearly a year in business, and the building has been vacant ever since.
The opening will mark the restaurant's third location in Scottsdale, and the 16 location in the greater Phoenix area.

title: Scottsdale City Council signs off on pricey high-rise project in Old Town
summary:
PHOENIX – A multimillion dollar mixed-use project intended to revitalize a tourist destination in Scottsdale has been approved by the city council.
The council OK’d plans for SouthBridge 2, which would take up about 10 acres in Old Town along the Arizona Canal, by a 4-3 vote during Wednesday’s meeting.
Space for up to 570 apartments and 200 hotel rooms have been designed into the project near Goldwater Boulevard and Fifth Avenue.
In late October the members approved the $300 million Museum Square for the Old Town Arts District.
Four buildings at Goldwater near Marshall Way were earmarked for residences.
